children.subject: Recommend 61C + 189 next semester, took this combo last year and enjoyed it since both professors are really good, and both courses are really useful. Leave 170 to senior year is perfectly fine. It has lower workload than 61C or 189, which is ok to take during recruiting season. I taking it right now and I kind of regret taking it since you really don't need it for interviews. Greedy and DP can be self-studied very well. Haven't taken 127 so I can't comment on it, but you don't need it for 189. MATH 54 is enough.

I agree with what's said above--it would be hard to take those classes while looking for jobs at the same time. Also, I would suggest you not be so fixated on the idea of taking 127, unless you want to do traditional optimization research. Taking 127 would definitely help 189, but it doesn't contain much useful material that 189 doesn't cover, that is, 189 touches almost everything you need about optimization (in the ML context).

And you would only need the vector calculus part of 127 for 189. If you won't take 127, it will suffice if you just take a read of the vector calculus page on Wikipedia.

history.content:
I am planning on taking CS 189 in either Junior year spring semester or first semester senior year.

But I want to take 127 before I take 189 and if I take  189 in Junior year second sem, I need to do 127 next to next semester along with 170 and 61C, which i think will be a very heavy courseload amidst recruitment.

If I take 189 in first semester senioryear, will it be disadvantageous, because I want to avoid 127, 170 and 61C all together.

Thanks a lot!
history.subject: Right time to take CS 189
